resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
I successfully installed the C++ and Glib packages on my CentOS 7 server according to [https://arrow.apache.org/install/]

 

 
{code:java}
> install.packages("arrow")

Installing package into ‘/opt/appdisk/lib/R/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu-library/4.0’
 (as ‘lib’ is unspecified)trying URL 'https://cran.rstudio.com/src/contrib/arrow_5.0.0.tar.gz'Content type 'application/x-gzip' length 463913 bytes (453 KB)==================================================downloaded 453 KB* installing source package ‘arrow’ ...** package ‘arrow’ successfully unpacked and MD5 sums checked

using staged installation*** Arrow C++ libraries found via pkg-config at

comments.body: Perhaps this is not relevant, but it looks like you haven't installed arrow-dataset-devel and parquet-devel, which you probably want. Try that?

[~npr] Both packages are already installed and on the latest version:

 

Package arrow-dataset-devel-5.0.0-1.el7.x86_64 already installed and latest version

Package parquet-devel-5.0.0-1.el7.x86_64 already installed and latest version

Odd, pkg-config doesn't appear to be finding them, they're not listed in PKG_LIBS. Though this shouldn't be related to the compilation issue you're experiencing, we test that the R library builds even if not all arrow C++ features are built.
[~npr] it worked after setting the environment variable {{ARROW_USE_PKG_CONFIG=FALSE}}
